intro: Spilanthes paraguayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay stinkcup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a spherical shape, and it produces a distinctive, pungent odor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
